intro: Hymenoxys schaffneri, commonly known as the Schaffner's globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its showy, saucer-shaped yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. It has palmate leaves with five to seven lobes and produces capsules as its fruit. Hymenoxys schaffneri is often found in desert scrub and grassland habitats, where it thrives in full sun.
